page.title: 15Dovercourt-Lighthouse Appeal
page.content: Despite their movable nature, the Dovercourt lighthouses were never moved, even though the channel continued to shift. The Dovercourt Lights were finally extinguished in 1917,because the channel had been marked with lighted buoys.There were many lighthouses of this type around the coast of Britain but they have nearly all disappeared. The Dovercourt two - one on land, the other at sea at high tide _ are the only pair to survive. They are a good example of their type and every effort is being made to preserve and restore them.In recent years the High Stewards Lighthouse Appeal has been launched and funds are now enough to restore the one on the shore,as a historic landmark. Restoration of the other lighthouse will hopefully come later.
